column4: my computer is stuck when i turn it on it says "|Checking for running unattended upgrades" and it stays like that forever. Now I am in recovery shell and what do i do to fix it?
why did you end up in recovery shell? what happened when you tried to boot normally
nevermind misread
you could try apt-get remove unattended-upgrade
unattended-upgrades
it says W: not using locking for read only lock file /var/lib/dpkg/lock    E: unable to write to /var/cache/apt   E: the package lists or status file could not be parse or open
do i just do sudo first heh
if you are truly in a recovery console you shouldn't need to sudo, but if you aren't root you would need to sudo
i am truly in recovery mode, the prompt is root@computername   and i just did sudo it has no effect
sounds like the lock file is bad. you can remove the lock file and try again
sounds like you need to fsck /
do i just run the command fsck right now in the shell or is that something i have to reboot and pick or w/e
since your / is mounted ro you can safely fsck now
i did fsck , it was instantly done and said clean or something. went back to try those other commands and everything still responds the same way ('read only file system')
so now you can mount -o remount,rw /
when you have an unclean dismount (like a forced power off) then the fs may be dirty and unable to be mounted rw until after fsck is run
/ is ro so nothing is currently writable
Jordan_U  do i just reboot now ?
is that stopping the boot?
I guess so, its just sitting at that screen for a minute now
does ctrl-alt-f1 take you to a login prompt
no, it does nothing
well i guess boot back to recovery and reinstall the unattended-upgrades package. im not sure what exactly has gone wrong with it though
